item.title: Gemstones
item.description:
#Category #Gemstone
Gemstones are mineral depositions which hold a specific magical power when infused with Mana. All gemstones can be infused by the use of liquid Mana, as is usual on Scintilla, but each specific Gemstone also has a way of being infused by placing them in a certain location or performing certain actions in their vicinity.
Not all gemstones are classical, transparent, decorative stones. Some are completely opaque and were not considered gemstones before the discovery of their magical powers.



Diamond, the stone of clarity and purity
Citrine, the stone of lightning and freedom


Sapphire, the stone of cold and the arcane
Amethyst, the stone of life cycles and time


Ruby, the stone of light and the sun
Pyrope, the stone of heat and energy


Emerald, the stone of trust and linkage
Topaz, the stone of spatial warping and attraction


Malachite, the stone of hypnosis and music
Red Jasper, the stone of blood and rage
#Category #Gemstone

item.title: Astrid Pince
item.description:
#NPC #Druid #Wizard
Astrid Pince is a proliferous Biomancer and the head of the Brineheads. She was born in the winter of 606 in Skar, to a family considered middle class by city standards- although the Pince family was one of the richest in town. Skar suffered from food shortages then, relying on local foraging while the Lack made the natural regeneration of food more and more scarce.
She always had a particular knack for biology and the arcane. Sent to the SIAA when she was 12, she quickly developed an interest in The Lack, since its physical effects were even more prominent in Sheilwind. Inspired by the resilience of the local people and their architecture specially adapted against the troubles caused by the Lack, a seed began to grow; an idea to make the people themselves more resilient against the elements. The early attempts would be gruesome, at first- the people would resent her methods, at first- but once her idea of a more perfect human form would be a reality, she would be worshipped as a savior.
In her late teens, she would gather some fellow students with academic interests in line with her own, and found the Brineheads. Operating from a secret base under the Granite Oyster in Sheilwind, she attempted each night to fuse human subjects with more evolved marine life. She struck a deal with a group called the Skulkers, a bandit organization, to traffic teens to her secret lair. Younger subjects were more malleable, and has a lesser chance to die in the fusing process.
Experiments would always turn out imperfect, sometimes impairing the subject's movement by the scales and carapace growing out of unwieldy places, and always erasing the subject's self-consciousness.
#NPC #Druid #Wizard

item.title: Elan Severas
item.description:
#NPC #Herbalist #Alive
Elan Severas is an Essurian herbalist specializing in restoring potions. He has a standing deal with Inquisitor Cobal that he'd sell his supply of health-restoring potions as soon as he can make new ones. He asked a band of adventurers (Dovus Eilian +, Kemo Kantaki +, Lucy Nightglow +) to collect some Sparkweed to continue brewing these restoring potions on the 7th of April 664, but hasn't heard from them since.
#NPC #Herbalist #Alive

item.title: Flow's End
item.description:
Flow's End, the Riverward, Sashimi Chef, Grappler of Wyrms, The Ocean's Motion, The Ancient Innocence, Barrel Roller, The Handy-man, Fisherman's Friend, The Arisen, Boombeard's Eldest, Pince's Pincer, Homewrecker, The Uncracked, Antiquity's Acquaintance, the Sediment of Time, the Cheddarbox...
...is a self-powered prototype Waterwheel Golem originally devised by Joardyn Boombeard. Charon Yrial and Patrick Marvers found them abandoned, lying in an overgrown creek, barely functional. They befriended them swiftly, called it a "him", and brought it on the first raid on the Granite Oyster.
Flow's end has a brother, Glitz, which a more advanced prototype devised by Joardyn.

item.title: Jericho Palitus
item.description:
Jericho (or "Jerry") is a half-elf archeologist mage working at the Sheilwind Institute for the Arcane Arts. He grew up in Sheilwind. He is in his forties and has black, slightly curly hair with large sideburns. On his nose rests a pair of thick-rimmed glasses that make his eyes look slightly larger than they are.
Despite this goofy appearance, his demeanor is often serious and to the point. He doesn't like being around people much, and much prefers the company of a good history book, or visiting the Pisceo Museum.

item.title: John Nightglow +
item.description:
#NPC #Spellbreaker
John Nightglow, formerly John Trellis before marrying Abigail Nightglow, was a Spellbreaker in Essuria and the father of Lucy Nightglow +. He gained renown during the year 663 by speaking out against the bureaucratical practices of the Spellbreakers, against the wishes of Inquisitor Cobal and Inquisitor Cupra.

John died on the 6th of April 664, protecting his daughter Lucy Nightglow + from being hit with an Orcish arrow.
#NPC #Spellbreaker

item.title: Sarah Turner
item.description:
#NPC #Essuria #Engineer #Alive
Sarah Turner is an old classmate of Dovus Eilian +, whom she thought was dorky but cute. She ran the tinkerer's shop called Cog Blox. Sarah has blonde hair, blue eyes, and a sassy, disinterested attitude.
#NPC #Essuria #Engineer #Alive

item.title: Snuggles
item.description:
Snuggles is the cat of Lucy Nightglow +. His personality is generally fussy and demanding, although surprisingly sweet to those who accept his grumpiness. Always hisses at Mammon Avari.
After Lucy Nightglow + died in The Pit, Snuggles roamed the nearby Darkwood Forest and can still be found there, carrying a bear tooth in her beak wherever she goes. She is one of the few cats that doesn't get killed by the nearby | Greenskin tribes, instead lovingly fed.

item.title: Essurian Greenskin Incident of 664
item.description:
#Event #Essuria
The Essurian Greenskin Incident of 664 was an event on the 6th of April, 664, in which Greenskins attacked the Eastern city walls. During the assault, which came unexpectedly and without precedent, the Goblins and Orcs burned down the Mahogany Library and stole food from surrounding greenhouses belonging to House Agricola.
One of the Spellbreakers was killed, John Nightglow +, while trying to protect his daughter Lucy Nightglow + from an Orcish arrow. She had come with her friends Crowe +, Dovus Eilian + and Kemo Kantaki + in order to defend the city. The Greenskins retreated before any revenge could be served by a furious and mourning Lucy. Mammon Avari stopped her in her tracks by using a Bubble of Alterian spell, causing much discontent.
Parvati Silverquill reported on the incident in the controversial newspaper The Gilded Word on the 7th of April, stating that the security measures around the Eastern walls were faulty, the location was suspiciously precisely located in a dead spot of the vision of two Weather Towers of House Meteos, and only a handful of Spellbreakers were on-site on time to protect the citizenry. She also expressed much discontent around the unwillingness of Inquisitor Cupra to admit any fault.
This incident was considered a turning point in the Essurian zeitgeist, often marked as a vital event leading to the increasing factionalization and hostility within the city; a crucial fanning of the flames lit by forbidding large swaths of the citizenry to use Mana Fountains for personal ends, while The Four Essurian Houses were unaffected.
#Event #Essuria

item.title: Brineheads
item.description:
#Faction #Sheilwind
The Brineheads are a cult of evolutionary accelerationists active in Sheilwind from 635. Their goal is to create a new species of human, more resilient against the harsh challenges of The Lack. They attempt to fuse humans with primarily marine species in order to grant them a new level of resilience against the elements. Their activities thus far have mainly been experimenting on unwilling human subjects, mainly late teens. Their logic behind this is they believe younger humans are smart enough to keep sufficient reasoning skills to follow orders when fused with animals, but their brains and bodies are still pliable and moldable enough that the fusion process isn't deadly to them.
They are lead by a biomancer called Astrid Pince, who is crazed, delusional, and wants to turn herself and all her followers into crabs eventually.
Their main base is located in a submarine cove, magically sealed against the ocean above. The regular way to enter this cove is by an old monumental ship called the Granite Oyster, which has been stationary on the Eastern dock in Sheilwind.
#Faction #Sheilwind

item.title: Circle of the Moon
item.description:
#Faction #Scintilla
A secretive organization of Druids mainly active on Scintilla. Not many members are known, but it is believed to be led by a handful of Archdruids.
Grace Nightglow is one of its members.
It was requested that The Good, the Sad, and the Angry deliver the Sapphire Key to them instead of Mammon Avari, so they might keep it safe.
#Faction #Scintilla

#Faction #Essuria
Meteos is the Essurian house responsible for its weather redirection systems. Notable members include Nebula Torrena, Brigitta Catago, and Mammon Avari.

item.title: Skulkers
item.description:
#Faction #Antagonist #Sheilwind
The Skulkers are a smuggling ring active throughout Scintilla, whose main activity involved smuggling children to the Brineheads for Astrid Pince. They are recognizable by their bald heads and signature hooked daggers.
A small subgroup of them was caught around the autumn of 648 by Patrick Marvers, who was 16 years old at the time. They were believed to be completely dismantled by the authorities of Sheilwind then. In reality, they simply moved their operations to mostly outside Sheilwind. In 664, they dared return their operations to within the city itself,
They are responsible for the death of Sonja Kull, whom they tried to kidnap in the summer of 650. After she flew into a rage and fought back harshly, killing a Skulker, she was beaten to death by the group, found by Valda Kull +.
#Faction #Antagonist #Sheilwind

item.title: Spellbreakers
item.description:
#Faction #Essuria
#Faction #Essuria
The Spellbreakers are the de facto police force in Essuria. The faction is fully controlled by House Meteos. They are recognizable by their deep purple robes and shaved heads.
Their fighting style is reminiscent of martial arts used by monks. Using Talent, enhanced by specifically designed Azurine bracers, they are able to counter Mana-based magic, with highly ranked individuals even able to redirect spells back at their casters.

Spellbreakers utilize Talent in order to break up spells, enchantments, or wards created by casters. A well-studied phenomenon called the Exclusion Principle states that mana cannot inhabit the same location as a Soul. Using this principle, Spellbreakers are taught to extend a piece of their soul outwards, projecting it outside themselves. Bending streams of woven mana is a more advanced technique taught to veteran Spellbreakers, which allows them to redirect spells to a different target.

item.title: The Four Essurian Houses
item.description:
#Faction #Category
House Ferris, led by Nyla Sonore, is in charge of the Essurian Engineer's Guild, and pioneering technological tools and advancements.
House Meteos, led by Mammon Avari researches advanced magical techniques, and is in charge of the Weather Towers, which redirects storms and keeps the city's climate sunny and pleasant.
House Paramagis, led by Inquisitor Cobal, specialize in non-Manaweaving forms of magic, sometimes called Talents. They lead the Spellbreakers, the main lawkeeping force in the city.
House Agricola, led by Sylva Syldaris, specialize in nature-related magics, and is in charge of the city's greenhouses and food supply.
#Faction #Category

item.title: Wood Elves
item.description:
#Species #Faction
Wood Elves are about one and a half spans in length, with green eyes, tan, rough skin, and bark-like protrusions on their wrists and ankles. Their hair colour varies from a faintly reddish hazel to raven black. Their only known population inhabits Albaren on Tara; Wood Elf culture is largely unknown to other races.. Their population seems to consist mainly of females. No report of wood elf children has ever been encountered.

"The Song of the Forest"- a term you may recognize if you have been reading up on their culture- is one of the Wood Elves’ defining features. This ability to communicate with plants and kin alike grants them great advantages in both battle and society. The Song itself is actually more like a collection of musical scales and genres, each Song conveying a different emotion or implication. Wood Elves all speak Elvish and Common beside their song, used to convey more elaborate concepts. While talking, they are able to both sing or hum a melody and pronounce words, using the melody to add emotional context to the words they pronounce. Any man who hears a Song naturally feels the emotions behind it, but cannot Sing himself. This talent seems to be inherent to the Wood Elves exclusively.
#Species #Faction

item.title: Bouldervine
item.description:
#Plant
A vine growing on rocky surfaces. It produces a penicillin-like substance that kills moss growing nearby its roots. It produces small fruits toward the end of autumn, which look like pebbles. Their inside is a lightly sweet yellow structure, like a mango.
#Plant

item.title: Cauthons Leaf
item.description:
#Plant #Herb
An incredibly rare find, this five-leaved, black-spotted clover is a magical plant strongly enhancing the luck of one who plucks it. There are so few of them, and the ones that were found originated from such extremely different biomes, nothing is really known about their preferred climate, ways of growing, how their seeds look like, or how they procreate. All that is left is to feel lucky for a day once you stumble upon one.
#Plant #Herb

item.title: Charwasp
item.description:
#Fauna #Insect #Creature
A tiny flying insect as large as a thumbnail native to Tara. Normally pitch-black and very slow, these strange creatures are attracted to fire and heat, usually resting in flames wherever they can find them. Once they have been in a fire, their body starts to glow a fiery orange, like hot coals, and their speed increases proportional to the brightness of their glow. They are not aggressive towards other species while unprovoked, but swarms of white hot charwasps are known to singe the skin of the odd unlucky fellow deciding that pouring water over a charwasp was a good idea.
#Fauna #Insect #Creature

item.title: Cindershell
item.description:
#Plant #Herb
Reminiscent of a large crimson barnacle, this plant bulb grows on rocky surfaces in dry, hot, mountainous areas. The shells are hard to come by, but ground up, they can be used to create an Armor Potion.
#Plant #Herb

item.title: Dragon's Tooth
item.description:
#Plant #Succulent #Herb
A small, char-black succulent plant, shaped like a sunflower seed pointing upwards from the ground. Only growing in the driest areas like deserts, many ignorant fools have killed themselves stepping on the venomous sting on top of the plant. If you have the right tools and knowledge, the sting can be extracted from the plant and ground up to make an incredibly potent weapon poison, inflicting the targets wound with a spreading sickness, dark as night and burning like dragonfire.
#Plant #Succulent #Herb

item.title: Frostblade
item.description:
#Plant #Herb
Contrary to what the name suggests, this species of parsley is most commonly found on subtropical beaches. It gets its name from the white outline on its leaves, which in turn are excess salt deposits. Its flavor, excluding the dominant tone of salt, is somewhere in between thyme and curly leaf parsley. In a pinch, it can be used to ineffectively and painfully disinfect wounds, but it’s better used for making stews taste absolutely delicious. It can also be used to make spell regeneration potions.
#Plant #Herb

item.title: Glimmerbough
item.description:
#Plant #Tree #Algae
An alien-looking, barkless willow that undergoes constant symbiosis with a shimmering green species of algae (Nephroselmis scintillans, or Glimmergoo) for protection. Completely coated with the extremely sticky algae, the tree is protected against dehydration and intrusive fungi native to the swamp. The same stickiness catches insects, which are digested by Nephroselmis scintillans to provide nutrients otherwise low in supply within the swampy area the Glimmerbough lives in. Its leaves provide a natural dissolvent for the glue-like properties of Glimmergoo.
The leaves can be combined with the goo for an incredibly effective yet foul-tasting conservation agent (when used in small amounts). Glimmerbough root tea is said to make bellyaches and other digestive problems disappear instantly, though there are very few who can access the roots without sticking themselves to the tree first.
#Plant #Tree #Algae

item.title: Ironbark
item.description:
#Plant #Tree
This incredibly strong species of oak, less tall but stouter and thicker than most other trees, is reasonably common in any temperate climate. It gets its name from both its strength and its silvery grey bark. It is well known to be the last leafy tree to lose its leaves at the end of the warm season, normally starting to brown only after the first snow has fallen. Though common, its wood is sought after by many nobles because of both its serene pale brown color and its durability, a chair or table made from it often lasting multiple generations. However, the tree is incredibly tough to chop down, hence the wood is hard to come by. It has become so popular among the rich, several noble houses have incorporated this tree into their sigils.
#Plant #Tree

item.title: Sparkweed
item.description:
#Plant #Herb
A small weed consisting of a star-like formation of leaves growing flatly on the ground, about half a human hand in diameter. Its primary use in the 7th century is the creation of healing potions. Its leaves resemble those of basil, though pointier and accentuated by a reddish glow around the veins. It is most often found in dry, mediterranean climates. Its specific requirements for soil nutrients make it a rare find, mostly used on open hillsides in forests. Its taste is sharp, tantalizing and electrifying, hence the name. If applied on a wound in large enough amounts (more than three or four leaves), the plant numbs pain rather than stinging. It serves as an antibiotic and doubles as a go-to herb to spice up dishes in many ancient recipes- although this use has fallen out of flavor with the weed becoming more and more sparse, because of large-scale potion production. It is also known to relieve depression temporarily.
#Plant #Herb

item.title: Syldara's Braid
item.description:
#Plant
This long, stringy species of verdant green moss can be found anywhere in the known world where the air is humid. When dried, the fibres make for excellent rope.
This is the reason most ropes on Tara are a faded green.
#Plant

item.title: Willowblossom
item.description:
#Drink #Consumable #Alcohol
#Drink #Consumable #Alcohol
Willowblossom is a local export by the small village of Fairbanks, located in central Tara. It is a mead made from honey that has been infused by flowers of the willows that grow alongside the river Thiadrelle. About 1/10th of the drink consists of pure alcohol.
It is well known throughout Tara for being a summer delicacy, since it's only produced in late spring. The drink itself is quite shelf-stable, but due to high demand, becomes prohibitively expensive towards the end of each year.

item.title: Dawn of Remembrance
item.description:
#Upgrade #Ability #Warlock
#Upgrade #Ability #Warlock
You offer some life force to accurately recall knowledge.
You may pay 10 HP once per long rest to either:

Un-prepare a spell and prepare another in its stead, or
Recall a piece of information you have heard with exact accuracy, by asking the DM.

item.description:
#Upgrade #Ability #Wizard
#Upgrade #Ability #Wizard
You learn the "Mirror Image" spell.
Whenever one of your Mirror Images is killed by a melee attack, you may use your reaction to cast a cantrip targeting the killer.

item.title: Gust-step
item.description:
#Upgrade #Ability #Rogue
#Upgrade #Ability #Rogue
Once per short rest, you may Dash as a free action. Your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity this turn.

item.title: Rite of Cloudless Sight
item.description:
#Upgrade #Ability #Warlock
#Upgrade #Ability #Warlock
You offer some life force to increase the acuity of your senses.
You may pay 5 HP at any time to gain the following bonuses for 1 minute:

You gain advantage on Perception and Insight checks.
Creatures have disadvantage on Stealth and Deception checks against you.

item.title: Snatch
item.description:
#Upgrade #Ability #Rogue
#Upgrade #Ability #Rogue
Once per short rest, on a successful Deception roll toward each onlooker, you may choose an uncarried object of 10 pounds or less that you can see within 30ft. and have it fly toward your hand unnoticed.

item.title: Storm Surge
item.description:
#Upgrade #Ability #Fighter
#Upgrade #Ability #Fighter
Attacks made during your Action Surge deal an additional 1d12 Lightning damage.

item.title: Sunforged Chassis
item.description:
#Upgrade #Construct
#Upgrade #Construct
Roll your to-hit die and gain max HP equal to the result + Constitution modifier.

item.title: Sunlit Confluence
item.description:
#Upgrade #Ability #Fighter
#Upgrade #Ability #Fighter
Once per long rest, as a bonus action, choose a hostile creature and mark it with a ray of sunlight. Each of your allies may immediately spend their reaction to make an attack of opportunity against the target.

item.title: Vault of the Swan
item.description:
#Upgrade #Ability #Rogue
#Upgrade #Ability #Rogue
Once per short rest, you may glide 5ft. into the air for every 5ft. of horizontal movement you make. You can't take fall damage as a result of this jump. If you land on a creature this way, you land a guaranteed hit (no roll, no crits).

item.title: Voidglass Insight
item.description:
#Upgrade #Ability #Wizard
#Upgrade #Ability #Wizard
You may infuse any small gemstone using a 1st-level spellslot.

item.title: Whirlwind
item.description:
#Upgrade #Ability #Fighter #Battlemaster
#Upgrade #Ability #Fighter #Battlemaster
Spend a superiority die while attacking to create a gust of wind originating from you. All creatures within 5ft. must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed away from you by 15ft., taking damage from the Superiority die.

item.title: Diamond Module
item.description:
#Upgrade #Item #Construct
#Upgrade #Item #Construct
Once per short rest, you may spend a bonus action to create a 10ft. radius around you in which the air is distorted to make you look transparent. You and any creatures within the radius gain advantage on Stealth checks for 1 minute.

item.title: Red Jasper Module
item.description:
#Upgrade #Item #Construct
#Upgrade #Item #Construct
Any time you deal damage with a melee attack, roll 1d4 and add that many charges to this module.
As a bonus action, touch a creature. It regains HP equal to the amount of charges.
Charges are depleted on use, or when finishing a short rest.

item.title: Aqyla
item.description:
Aqyla, the Risen City, is a large city situated on a floating island above the Grayne desert in Barren Grayne. It is home to the Empyreans, a forgotten race of angel-like people.
The city makes extensive use of something they call Voidglass, a material made in the Sunforge which, when cut, can hold elemental energy from any of the 8 basic gemstones.

Library of Azu, full of arcane knowledge.
Sunforge, where the sun's heat is used for forging and the production of Voidglass.
The two massive winged golems, Cloudgulper & Lodefisher, that collect water and metallic dust respectively.
Shroomery, where the majority of the food supply stems from.
Lidya's Great Condenser, an array of diamonds above a basin with Azurine taps attached to them. Periodically, the diamonds infuse from the great height, and are then drained of mana which drops into a pool.

They believe Kathaeron is to the north, but that has been the result of centuries of misinformation from visitors.

item.title: Cog Blox
item.description:
#Location #Shop #Essuria
Cog Blox is a small tinkerer's shop in Essuria, run by Sarah Turner most of the time. Dovus Eilian + regularly went there for parts.
A small cat named Rusty inhabited the corner, regularly fussing with Snuggles.
#Location #Shop #Essuria

item.title: Essurian Redirection Matrix
item.description:
#Building #Essuria #Location
#Building #Essuria #Location
The Redirection Matrix is a network of five Azurine-laced towers along the walls of Essuria. They are maintained by House Meteos and serve the city by redirecting and dispersing storms and hurricanes coming towards Essuria. This keeps the city sunny all year through.
Each tower has its own Mana Fountain at the base.

item.title: Granite Oyster

item.title: Mana
item.description:
#Force
#Force
Mana is the universal force that encapsulates and inundates all that exists inside the universe. Casters are individuals able to manipulate this force and bend it to their will, pulling mana from the environment in small streams, and weaving them into complicated geometrical shapes. This manipulation is commonly known as "Magic".

Depending on the type of geometry a stream of mana is woven into- taking into account how angular or curved it is, whether it is helical or linear, whether it contains loops, how many lines of symmetry it has- it can affect the world in a plethora of ways. It can combust, create gravitational anomalies, stick objects together, reshape matter,


Flow describes how a particular, single stream of mana looks like when viewed up close. Multiple words may be used to describe a particular flow- for example,
Meandering

Free-flowing, like a river would show on a map.
Used for spells that affect an organism on impact, since the streams can conform to their physical form.
Waved
Sinusoidal and wavy.
Used for spells which affect a small area.
Straight
Straight line.
Used for single-target spells, often those with intent of harm.
Triangular
Wave-like, but with angular crests.
Used for spells which affect multiple targets individually, or can chain between targets.
Spiked
Thorny protrusions alongside the stream.
Used for hyper destructive spells that often can't distinguish between friend and foe.
Looped
Looping back in on itself.
Used for spells that remain in place or increase in intensity over time.

Linear - Straight line towards the intended target.
Hyperbolic - Mana stream initially pointing away from the caster and converging on the target.
Knotted - Woven back in on itself. Used for wards and traps.

The Exclusion Principle states that Mana cannot exist in the same location as Soul does.

#Material #Metal
Azurine is a slightly blueish silvery metal. Its main notable attribute is its ability to conduct streams of Mana. This creates an attractive force with objects that have a strong connection with the Weave, like infused gemstones. In practically every contraption making use of Gemstones, Azurine is a necessity for harnessing their power. The most common way of enhancing an item with the power of a gemstone is done via a standard azurine interface called a Gemslot. In military or heavy-duty applications, azurine is often alloyed with steel to create ferroazurine, slightly reducing its conductive capabilities but greatly increasing its durability.

A gemslot is a usually thumb-sized, bowl-like piece of azurine. They are carved in such a way that standard-cut gems fit snugly into the slot. Azurine's natural attraction to gemstones is the sufficient to bind to the gem, creating a connection from the Weave directly to the object. In effect, it transfers the infusion energy of a gem onto the other object; for example, a sword with a slotted Pyrope gains some of the properties of fire, such as light and heat. The higher the purity of the azurine used, the more powerful effects the slot can convey onto an object.

Practicioners of magic find it trivial to work with the semi-liquid form of Mana the fountains produce, and manipulating arcane power in this form allows any mage far greater power than they would otherwise be able to wield. Even regular citizens can produce a handful of cantrips with access to liquid Mana.
Throughout Scintilla, it is widely known that the mana-pulling effect of these fountains cause The Lack in distant lands, and as such, their use has been restricted in large parts of the continent. The people of Essuria, however, have kept using Mana for research by the Academy, redirecting the storms caused by the Lack away from the Golden City, and other, more frivolous ends for decades, causing much dislike and discontent around Scintilla.

item.title: Charon Yrial
item.description:
#PlayerCharacter #Alive #YvoSnoeker #Wizard #Changeling

"I... don't remember."
Sitting in a dark room. Blinking as a light is turned on. A reflection in a mirror. My own? I don't know. A face, not my own, looking at me with a grim expression. "Sure you do. I'll make you remember."
A dark night, moonless, lifeless. A forest, soundless. Footsteps... my own. "Forwards", I hear someone say. Myself? "Run, you dog!"
"Boss, I think he's dead." "WHAT?" I hear the words, not mine. Am I dead?
Sunlight. Bright, dazzlingly bright. Water, a small pond. I see... someone. Myself? Is this... my face? What do I remember?
A name? Charon. Yral? Yrial? Yriel. That's the name I've told people, at least. Is it mine? Is anything?
Charon. I remember... a glimmer. A memory, covered in mist. Two figures. My parents. Love. Warmth. It feels like too long ago.
What happened? To... me?
I... changed. The world changed. Everything... changed.
Another memory, drifting past. I see my parents, weeping. Mourning. Me? No. My sister. Ara. I remember her. I loved her. She's dead.
Fire. Hatred. Death. Not just Ara. Many of... us? Who was us? Who were... they? I don't... remember. Charon. That's me. I'm alive. I suppose.
Why?
WHY?
All things end. Ara... ended. My parents? Maybe. I will end. The world will end. It is only natural.
No point to resist. It is the way of things, to end. This, I remember. Charon. I guide things... towards their end. That is why.
A light.
My light. A flame. A lantern. I guide life to its end. I do not hate life. I do not hate death. It is my duty. I accept my duty. This... I remember.
Can... can it change?
I don't know.
I don't remember.

item.title: Dovus Eilian +
item.description:
#PlayerCharacter #Dead #YvoSnoeker #Engineer #Artificer

tap tap Electrical feedback "Is... Is this thing working? OH! Too loud, adjust it a bit... right,  that's better. 
This is Dovus Eilian, in the year 711. Artificer by trade, connected to the Essurian Engineer's Guild. Whoever's listening, please, don't make the Doofus joke in your head... it's gotten old, over the years. My parents really did a number on me with that, all because they saw a white dove fly up towards the moonlit sky, just before their first kiss... sigh By Syldara, do I miss them... 
Anyway. As said, I'm Dovus. This is... a timepiece, as I call it. It's a reflection on my life, from the vantage point of the ripe age of 75. A good time to reflect on a lifetime of adventure and wonder, or so I thought. Let's start from the beginning. 
I was born in Essuria. As a kid, I was always fascinated with birds, gazing at them as they soared high in the sky. I distinctly remember, at the age of five, thinking to myself: I want to fly just like them. Upon telling this to my mother, she said that, with hard work, perhaps I could, one day. I looked at her, astonished. How?! Then, she told me about a place that has set the course for all my life after it: the Engineer's Guild. As she explained this marvellous place, rife with experiments and inventions, I decided that it was there that I needed to be. Of course, the Guild has no use for five year-olds, so I had to wait. But I did not idle. Every spare second thereafter, I used in order to prepare myself for that illustrious future of learning. I read, and read, and read, and tinkered, and tinkered, and tinkered. I think at least a hundred iterations passed before I finally completed my first, fully functioning flying contraption: a dove, which I aptly named Columbo. It has been my companion ever since, though naught a bolt remains the same as that dear initial version of my mechanical avian. 
As it turned out, the Guild was rather impressed with Columbo, and decided to allow me to become an apprentice. Years of hard work ensued, in which I honed my skills and perfected my craft. I studied under the great Nyla Sonore, the most brilliant woman I have ever met. Even to this day, I have not even come close to her level of craftsmanship. She taught me all I know, and more. I remember those years fondly... 
Although, as everything must, those times, too, came to pass. It was then that Mammon Avari published a call for brave adventurers to join him on his quest into the wilds. Intrigued, I signed up, though with little hope of being accepted for such an arduous and dangerous journey. Little did I know of what was to come... 
With a heavy heart, I said my goodbyes to my loving parents, Arial and Elna, and set out with a strange band of companions, who I will introduce shortly. Before that however, dear listener, a warning. What I am about to tell you may well frighten you to the core. For the secrets we found... they rocked my world to its core, and I have never been the same. You have been warned…
First, there was Lucy Nightglow +. A young girl with druidic powers, she was a real sweetheart. Sadly, before we set out on our journey, the city was attackd by a band of greenskins, in which her father valiantly sacrificed himself to save her life. This great loss caused her untold grief, and upon witnessing her father's swift burial, I myself, too, broke down in tears. Only now can I understand how this proved to be a portent of things to come… 
Then, there was Kemo Kantaki +. A reserved man, quiet, and careful with his words. He was no soft city-dweller, but rather a rugged outdoorsman, used to sleeping rough and braving the dangers of the outside. 
Finally, we were joined by Sumon Takh, a Firbolg and librarian in Essuria, whose library had burned down in the greenskin raid. A gentle giant, he disliked [Mammon](Mammon Avari) as much as the rest of us, it seemed, but decided that the city held nothing more for him.
Thus, we set out on our quest. First, we headed to a small village, braving swamp and forest. I fell sick due to some horrid leech, but recovered soon enough. There, we encountered Lucy's grandma, as well as Kemo's father! While Lucy was overjoyed to see her beloved elder, Kemo was quite the opposite. He seemed even more dour than usual… 
Sumon decided to leave us, and we set out towards our objective: a place called The Pit. Now, if that name already sounds ominous, the place itself was much, much worse. A massive hole in the ground, with some sort of inverse tower in the middle. We could barely even see the bottom… we were greeted by some utterly soulless person, Morose, and had to solve some riddles to enter into the place proper. Inside, we were greeted by… Bob. A monster unlike any I had ever seen, or have in all my years thereafter. It had an insane twinkle in each of its eyes, and seemed not just a little cruel. From here, we could see that inside The Pit, the people working were half-rotting creatures, and as Bob gleefully explained, he was mining them… for their hope. I am proud to say, that after many long years, I finally managed to destroy Bob and his tower for once and for all. But that is a story for later… 
As first, we headed into the crypts. What we found there, dear listener, may well shake you to your core…
screech screech 
Wait, you're still listening? Well, then, let me share with you a little secret: I am actually only 28 years old, not 75… this 'timepiece' was to be my retrospective, but I must admit that, having arrived at our destination, I have a gnawing fear that I may not reach that ripe old age intact… I'm lying in bed in some sort of magical room, created by that terrifying creature with many eyes and an insane look in each of them. Tomorrow morning, we set out into the crypts… and I do not know what we will face there. I hope everything will turn out alright… for now, though, dear listener, good night, and good luck.

Dovus Eilian died on April 17th, 664, at the age of 28, by the hand of the Subterranean Shambler, attempting to retrieve the Shard of Earth for Mammon Avari.

item.title: Lucy Nightglow +
item.description:
#PlayerCharacter #Dead #Druid #Firbolg

Lucy Nightglow was born and raised in Essuria as an only child. Since she had no siblings to play with and wasn't making many friends in school, she found herself adopting every stray animal on the street to befriend, to her mother's dismay. Since Lucy is an only child, her mother was fiercely protective over her, and did not educate her on the world beyond Essuria's walls and the devastating Lack that was ever expanding outwards. However, when on a stormy summer's day lightning struck in the suburbs, Lucy could not believe her eyes. The at that time 15 year old girl took her favourite pet Snuggles, a one-eyed mean looking old cat, and went to investigate. She had never thought that those loud lighting strikes she had seen in the distance could ever hit her here in Essuria. As she ran across the cobbled streets, she found a fire breaking out a peasant's home. She asked a passerby what could have happened, but the man just glared at her and told her the Lack was finally coming for them, the Lack that surrounded the city. Snuggles began to hiss and she bent down to calm him. Just as she was about to ask the man what the Lack was,  he'd already disappeared in the crowd that was starting to form.
It was then that she decided to look beyond the walls. She began plotting on how she would manage to go out and see this for herself. She'd heard some of the cool kids at school bragging on how they went outside the wall through a crack hidden in the wall in a poor district in the city. Late that night, she snuck out of the little house while her mum and dad slept, and scurried her way through the streets, Snuggles on her heels. She crept through the crack and when she stood up,  she was horrified. What laid before her was a dead waste. Her heart sank and tears came streaming down her face. She realized at that point that she must do something about it. Problem was, she had no idea what.
Then one day, as she was playing with the pigeons in the alley, she saw a poster on a wall of a certain Mammon Avari, asking for adventurers to help cleanse the Lack. She knew immediately what to do.
Her mother, Abigail Nightglow, owns a flower shop and grows her own vegetables. She's also the best cook in the world (according to Lucy) and has passed on some of her secret recipes to her. Although a bit overbearing, she's a kind and loving mother.
Her father, John Nightglow +, is in the town "peacekeep/police" force, the Spellbreakers, middle rank. This led him to be quite strict with Lucy's education (which she hated).
Her grandmother, Grace Nightglow, left Essuria when Lucy was just 5 years old, yet she remembers her fondly. She has druidic powers like Lucy does, and went out to explore and rediscover the Old Faith. Lucy is secretly hoping to meet her on her travels, as she feels quite alone with no (known) druids in her immediate circle.
Lucy does not have a lot of friends, but is friendly with other teens in the city, some of which are pursuing the arcane arts at the Academy. She never felt at home at the Academy however...

Lucy's first goal had been to help cleanse nature for which she cared so deeply, as well as potentially finding others of her firbolg or druid kind, and perhaps finding her grandmother out in the wilds. Although this is still part of her, she has become disgusted by her guide Mammon Avari, disgusted with the engineer's guild's lies and secrecy, and the last thing she wants is to feel used. Her love for animals and nature has however not withered, and will fuel her actions to come, to fight anyone needlessly harming animals or nature. Yet now she wishes to attack those humans that have hurt, used and abused her, and will be wary of everyone except for her mother, Dovus Eilian +, Kemo Kantaki + and Crowe +.
Kemo has won her trust, and Crowe seems to be likeminded to Lucy in a way she cannot describe. She is however wary of Dovus, as she felt he had a hand in these circumstances.
**

item.title: Patrick Marvers
item.description:
#PlayerCharacter #Rogue #Alive

The 32 year old Patrick Marvers, born in 632, son of Roy Marvers and Marie Marvers (née Lavère), appears to outside perception as an uninteresting, bland person. A deeper look however, shows this is a front, the biggest clue being his piercing stormy grey eyes. The second clue being how Patrick walks: His arms never move from the side of his body, his legs and eyes are the only things in motion, his slouch hiding how attentive he is.

Patrick, the sole child of the Marvers family (a mid-to-low-income family), was in his early years a bit of a troublemaker. He always tried to steal sweets from the local shop or convince the other children to let him "borrow" their toys indefinitely. These attempts were always foiled and Patrick was many times at the receiving end of punishment, be it from his teachers or his parents, sometimes both.
Tired of getting caught so often, Patrick realised that no matter how he strategised, he would be caught every time. But how could he improve his strategies, when he was always caught? After all, Patrick was sick of always getting caught.
Patrick had at that moment an epiphany: He could improve, by learning from others and what mistakes they made. Following that realisation, Patrick would stop his attempts at (juvenile) criminality. Instead, he observed. He watched and noted how other kids tried and failed in their attempts of tomfoolery, dutifully noting it down.

Patrick's career started more due to chance than skill: One day, during his high school years, he noted down how some adults were loitering around his place of education, Ashton High. Intrigued, he started paying more attention to how they were acting and what they were doing. When the first few of his peers started disappearing, Patrick shadowed these men back to their places and listened in on their conversations. After collecting enough material and evidence, he proceeded to inform the local police branch of his findings, citing the conversations he overheard from memory and presenting the notes he took of the routes and activities of the men. The smuggling ring, the Skulkers, quickly and decisively ended that day.
Patrick enjoyed the resulting accolades and cheer he received from those around him, even if it somewhat interfered with his observations. After a while, things died down again, but Patrick had gotten a taste for what he had a knack for: Detective work.
After graduating, he proceeded to set up his own Private Eye Agency: Marvers' Minute Inquest (MMI). His Agency works closely with local law enforcement and mercenaries in order to close his investigations successfully.
Through his work, Patrick continues to learn how others fail with their criminal activities and what punishments await them. Maybe one day, after all of his research, he would be able to pull it off: The untraceable crime.

Patrick looks like a worn-fown middle-aged man with brown short hair and grey eyes. Well-to do clothing. Pretty bland appearance.
#PlayerCharacter #Rogue #Alive

item.title: Valda Kull +
item.description:
#PlayerCharacter #Barbarian #Dead

Valda Kull, born in the spring of 636, grew up in the village of Skar, up in the mountains to the West of Sheilwind. She loved roaming the woods with her little sister, and she loved fighting since she was a child.
When she was 22 and her younger sister 16, a band of brigands named the Skulkers roamed the outskirts of town. Her sister, Sonja Kull, was out berry picking when they found her. They beat her to death. Valda has since had an addiction to alcohol, and has since been out as a bounty hunter, hunting the outskirts of cities and towns as well as within cities taking on odd jobs. She's been muscle for hire for years and is 28 years old in 664. She's run with a group of mercenaries/musle for hire named The Fall. This group of mercenaries exists of 4 other members, all fighter/barbarian types like herself. Through her time in the wilds, she has learnt to survive out in the Lack.
Now she is on their trail, and knowing they're out there leads her to go beyond her limits to find them and avenge her sister.
In any case, GOLD is another big motivator for Valda, so whatever way she goes, she would probably want to have to have some coin at the end of it to make it worth her time.
Other than that, she's very brusque, loves playing at cards and dice and generally drinking the night away. Will make fun of "weaklings", basically anyone without big muscles or noticeable skill at killing.

She's well known in Sheilwind and the surroundings as a very effective muscle for hire. People have learnt not to fuck with her, as she can have a short temper, but people generally respect her. Some of the richer families have hired her to protect their kin as they traverse around the city. She's been traversing the Lack for years now, and as a Wanderer she knows the terrain well as well as the potential dangers it holds.
She also has a good working relationship with the local guard, and especially Valda and Patrick Marvers have worked together numerous times. She is an authority figure among the rest of the guard/bounty hunter. She is however not very lawful, and is therefore a bit of a loose cannon compared to your average guard.
She spends most of her free time in taverns drinking, gambling, playing her lute and brawling with anyone who dares go against her. She's known to be intimidating, but never cruel. Therefore, she knows most tavern dwellers, and she often speaks with travellers who come through town and stay at the inn.
In her early twenties the used to run with a group of mercenaries named the Fall south(?) of the mountain range. In the beginning, her rage was hard to contain, but she managed to control her anger and direct it in a productive, destructive manner. However, during her time, she has rubbed some people in that area the wrong way and there may be some shadows from the past that would have reason to harm her.
Her relationship with her parents is OK. Since her sister's death, they've drifted apart from one another, and Valda hasn't seen them in years since she left, but she hopes they're doing OK.
Valda Kull was killed by a group of Skulkers on April 18th, 664, at the age of 28, after the party abandoned her.

item.title: Crypt of Asmodeus Intro
item.description:
#Writing
“Long gone will be the days of petty squabbles and mindless reverence. Brilliance and methodism paved the gilded path to enlightenment. And the fruits it bore will leave the populace in equal parts awe… and terror.” - excerpt from the personal diary of Ethan Asmodeus, Engineer at the Mahogany Library.
Now called the Golden City, Essuria was a poor excuse for a town- the smallest municipality on the continent that could call itself “town”, in fact. For centuries, its only redeeming quality was its excellent Mahogany Library, with a small but dedicated group of researchers, working long hours studying the arcane arts- both the intricacies of innate spellcasting, and the science of infused Gemstones. It was an engineer by trade, Ethan Asmodeus, who first combined the two disciplines, pouring decades of his life into creating what he called simply “The Attractor”. It was said to be a heavy, spherical object, made of gold, silver, Azurine, and several dozen types of gemstones scattered among the engraved leylines. This artifact, Asmodeus’ Attractor, enabled the wielder to attract massive amounts of Mana from the environment, keeping it stable but concentrated- in a perfect state for any caster to use, and to shape the world around them to their will.
Recognizing the danger- what if this thing would fall into the wrong hands?- Asmodeus wrote down his basic principles of mana extraction, the gems necessary, the metal architecture to keep it stable, and… disappeared. The Attractor, disappearing with him, unused, faded to legend, then to myth… but the blueprints he left behind would have a transformative impact on every facet of the society he abandoned.
Using Asmodeus’ principles, the researchers of the Mahogany Library created the Mana Taps- small spikes of metal and eight gemstones. Once planted into the ground, these Taps spread out their metallic roots, and slowly started to extract Mana from their environment, spewing it out the top in something that looks like a blueish mix between liquid and gas. A decade later, these Taps were commonplace, incorporated into Mana Fountains all around Essuria, and some other cities which had communities of sorcerers. 
The Taps grew over time, spreading their mystical roots further underground, generating more and more Mana. Within years, the Mahogany Library reinvented itself as the Academy, the place for mages and sorcerers to practice and hone their skills. Essuria grew to colossal size, aided by the free and abundant magic; Mana was now used to fertilize crops, ensuring harvests; to control the weather, keeping the populace safe from storms; then to heat metals and create beautiful works of craftsmanship; to create constructs offsetting the need for physical labor; then to clean the streets, to mend hinges, to remove moles, to cook muffins, cool drinks… There is no whim small enough not to warrant a little sprinkle of Mana in the Golden City.
The price for this decadence was paid, yes… but not by the people of Essuria.
Slowly, surely, as the centuries grew old, the grass outside the city walls started to wither. Storms deflected away from Essuria hit the countryside with twice the fury. Trees lost their leaves and grew thorns; flowers became dull and sour; grasshoppers became locusts; crops refused to grow to proper size, and the very soil itself became treacherous and dark. Now, there are few communities left outside the walls of the Great Cities, huddling together in surprising groves of green; blisters of hope in vast stretches of only half-life.
Now, news has come of the first failed harvest inside the walls of Essuria. It was in the paper last week, along with a natural lightning bolt striking a peasant’s roof in the suburbs. Something must be done, clearly. The lifeless void is creeping in. The Lack, they call it. The people of Essuria turn to more decadence in retaliation, but no amount of distraction or pleasure stops the endlessly marching Lack.
Mammon Avari, the lead archaeologist at the Academy, thinks he has the solution to the Lack. An old legend of a crypt somewhere on the other side of the continent might house a magical artifact he calls the “Tesseract”, an artifact that can control inconceivable amounts of Mana, an artifact potentially powerful enough to return the land to its lush state. Will you join him on an expedition to the far south? Will you be brave enough to persevere through the Fields of Carnage, the Acrid Swamps, and the Umbral Mountains? 
Send in your resume soon, for the application process is as cutthroat as you’d expect from an old Academy nut…

item.title: Session April intro
item.description:
As if by Slavoj Zizek
Now, last session, in a city paradoxically both rife with wealth and full of poverty, our old friend Patrick Marvers entered a store with the superficial intent of purchasing a nice hat. Now before we get to the psychoanalysis of the social interaction itself, we must confront the contradictions inherent in such a seemingly banal act as purchasing a hat. This simple action of purchase, of a relatively trivial commodity, upon closer inspection reveals a complex web of ideology that envelops us and guides our every action. You see, within exclusive circles, the aristocracy, having hair that was well-cared for was a sign of wealth less than a generation ago in Siltzport. Yet, as globalized trade started becoming more mainstream and hair oils, say from the Westland, Dayyin, Oltyron and so on and so on, were imported at a low price, even the proletariat came to have hair that was relatively well cared for.
Now the aristocracy immediately responded, since a hat- not a sailor's cap, mind you, a properly made, well-shaped hat- was a commodity that was on the expensive side of things. They started wearing hats to distinguish themselves from the lower class and retain their- this- this exclusivity. Now!... you see the paradox. Within one or two years, the surplus enjoyment which the aristocracy derived from showing off their nice hair, was transferred onto precisely its opposite: now the enjoyment was derived from covering up their nice hair. So now I will say something that will really provoke you: Nowadays even nice hats are getting cheap enough for the lower classes. within two years, the aristocracy will decide it's hip and trendy to wear these old proletariat yarn sailor's hats.
Let me conclude with an old Jewish joke, this is a classic joke from my childhood. Two Jewish children are playing an old Hebrew heretic tabletop game, Dungeons and Dreidels. They are having a good time even though their own mother forbid them from playing this seemingly harmless game. At a crucial moment in their fictional story, their mother all of a sudden steps into the room and says "This is not a proper Jewish tradition, stop playing this stupid game at once!" One of the children says "Mother do not worry, we are saving a town from a the Golem, it is a perfectly Jewish tradition".
Thank you, I talk too much.
GPT:
As we enter the boutique, adorned with extravagant displays of headwear, we are bombarded with choices that are not merely choices but ideological traps. Each hat we try on carries the weight of societal expectations, forcing us to conform to the norms of fashion and status.
But let us not be fooled by the allure of material possessions! The true essence of the hat lies not in its price tag or brand but in the symbolic power it holds. Just as ideology blinds us to the true nature of reality, so too do these hats serve as veils that obscure the truth of our existence.
As we stand in front of the mirror, adorned with a hat that screams of wealth and privilege, let us remember that beneath the facade lies a fragile ego, desperate for validation in a world that thrives on superficiality. The hat becomes a shield, protecting us from the harsh realities of social inequality and injustice.
So, my dear comrades, let us not be swayed by the seductive charm of designer labels and extravagant displays. Let us see beyond the hats and into the depths of our souls, where true liberation awaits. For in this city of riches, the most valuable hat we can wear is that of critical consciousness, unafraid to challenge the status quo and confront the illusions that bind us.

item.title: Session April intro 2
item.description:
As if by Slavoj Zizek
Now, my friends. last session, our friends set out to brutally invade some rich guy's manor in order to get some magical item, world is in peril, bla bla bla, and so on and so on. However, before they get to the object of their desire, they are confronted by some impossible contraption, some robot bird, who claims to be from their homeland, and was struck down from the heavens. Now, in the same way as the mythological stories, moments before a critical revelation, the sage figure comes along to give them some pieces of vital information. But ah! There is a problem. This supposedly all-knowing bird has a malfunction. It was not able to speak correctly, and as such, its presupposed wisdom is inaccessible to the adventurers.
Now, one of the uhh uhh, the uhh adventurers decides to fix up the bird, but finds out that he cannot possibly comprehend the bird's internal mechanisms. Immediately, he decides that he is capable enough, even though he has no engineering education of any kind- you see- this bird is a very complex thing which maybe even the most skilled artificers on the continent might be very hesitant to adjust- he decides that he is capable to fix this bird. By some trial and error, and the application of some arcane mystical power from his friend, the bird functions again and is able to give our friends the vital information. Here we see how ideology functions today- and you see the paradox here? We have this system that is supposed to guide us, but it refuses to give proper results until we collectively decide it needs to be changed. Then by as a result, we engage with it, and it works again, but only by the engagement itself- engagement that was in essence only possible precisely because we did not understand why it worked in the first place.
After this, they enter the mansion, where they are greeted by the powerful bourgeois wizard, Jean-Claude, that immediately displays an extremely powerful- and forgive me for the obscenity, but- this extremely powerful phallic object, a staff which supposedly is a gateway to some ancient unthinkable power, omnipotence, bla bla bla. Now if there is a lesson in Freudian psychoanalysis, it is that the entirely subconscious id is always in search of some external source of pleasure, power, women, money, and so on and so on. Immediately, we see this wizard faithfully guarding the object of his desire. How do you think the adventurers will respond? Of course, they immediately try to talk the old man into giving up this phallic object. Here we see what is symptomatic of the impotent left today: rather than the historically male pattern of seeking their own power, they choose the hysterical feminine way of accusing the other of putting them into this subordinate position and try to take it away from them in order to equalize.

item.title: Session April intro 3
item.description:
As if by Slavoj Zizek
My dear friends, today I want to talk to you a bit about morality. First, let me start off with a little old Marxist joke. How many communists does it take to screw in a light bulb sniff? The answer is none, the light bulb contains the seed for its own revolution.
Anyway. Some fellow philosophers would argue that every decision a human can make is in fact an ethical decision. So in a few days in-game ago, our friends made what these philosophers probably think was such an ethical decision. They were approached by the so-called "Mr Fisher", an obviously Bourgeois member of sniff society, and were sent to retrieve a fantastical object from a faraway place so that they may be paid handsomely. Immediately, they accepted. Why did they so readily accept this quest, where they have to go out of their way, be uncomfortable, fight opponents and so on and so on? You see, within the ideology of capitalism, the fetishization of the sublime object, the commodity, is made real by the ritual of a transaction. Within this ideology, where the transaction is thus sniff considered the highest ethical act, morality does not weigh into ethical decisions. A transaction which is perceived as fair is completed, and as such the act is indeed ethical according to our heroes immersed in capitalist ideology. Morality simply does not apply to the ethicality of the act. sniff
Now I will say something that will really provoke you. I claim that no act that is carried out purely automatically, or according to some script, can be considered moral or ethical. Morality is not this set of instructions written by the ego and handed onto the superego, which then logically parses the current state of affairs and emotionally forces the ego to act according to preordained principles. See for example the father that keeps running into a burning building to save his children, risking his own life in the process. What will sniff he tell you? sniff He would say: "What else could I do? I had no choice, they are my children!". So I say even acts like these, which are- I am not questioning it- which are good acts, are not ethical acts. I claim the only act that is ethical is indeed precisely where this set of moral instructions that we have pre-written breaks down, where the subject is truly at a loss on what to do. So our friends only made a truly ethical decision when the town captain came to their door asking for their help. Torn between their willingness to search for answers in service of the global greater good, and the direct suffering of their fellow townsmen that they can locally resolve, in a case where there are no obviously correct answers- they made a truly ethical decision. Thank you, I talk too much.

item.title: Jekyll
item.description:
Jekyll is a simple, blog-aware, static site generator perfect for personal, project, or organization sites. Think of it like a file-based CMS, without all the complexity. Jekyll takes your content, renders Markdown and Liquid templates, and spits out a complete, static website ready to be served by Apache, Nginx or another web server. Jekyll is the engine behind GitHub Pages, which you can use to host sites right from your GitHub repositories.

Jekyll does what you tell it to do — no more, no less. It doesn't try to outsmart users by making bold assumptions, nor does it burden them with needless complexity and configuration. Put simply, Jekyll gets out of your way and allows you to concentrate on what truly matters: your content.
